patterns: we will find your family members
responses: I live alone. My family lives in Houston
Nobody else. Just me!
No, only me. I rented this apartment and was going to buy a house here. Looks like that is not happening any time soon
Just me. Sometimes it makes me wonder whether i just have bad luck.
Me alone.
No its just me
I am the only one who survived

responses: A few scratches, nothing more
Not that I know of
Nothing major
Not much

patterns: Do you require any special medication?
responses: No i dont need medicine.
i dont need any medicine. I just need to get out of here

I do need some clean water

too bad. i should not be expecting anything from anyone at this point

patterns: do you want anything to eat
responses: I did not eat anything at all
Food? Our food stores got destroyed. Nothing left.
No
Not really
I was too worried to eat
I'm not hungry

patterns: Can you tell me what happened?
How did this happen at all?
responses: I remember waking up and the building shaking, and the shaking was getting more and more violent! It was shaking so much and I was trying to work out what was going on. And the noise, what I was able to make out of, was kind of like a river flowing angrily.
Our food stores got destroyed. Nothing left.

patterns: We need to get you to a safe place
Come with me. I will take you to a safe place
We should get out of here
im here to get you to safety
let's get you out of here
responses: I dont know what to do
There is nowhere safe anymore from what I have seen

patterns: did you try to contact anyone
did you try to communicate with anyone else
is there anyone you had contact with
responses: The communications went down. Complete loss of signal. I could not get through to anyone

patterns: What kind of struggle you faced due to flood
how did you fight the situation
how was the condition in the surrounding area
how did you deal with it
what where the situations you faced
Can you recollect on how the rains started
What kind of problems did you face initially
When did you feel you were amidst actual crisis
responses: The power went first. Then the food went bad. I had to last out for 5 whole days with soggy bread.
Following heavy rains for about a week, a lot of people who lived in the surrounding areas were affected
We remember for 5 days we were stuck in flood with no food and water, and then you finally showed up.
No one could contact us for almost 5 days, and we were all submerged in water with no food and water.

patterns: How did you prepare yourself to face the flood
were you alerted of the disaster before it happened
responses: Continuous rains did not allow us to do anything. In fact, we were stranded inside the house. We did not have much time to prepare.
No, we were not prepared.

patterns: please stand up and move backwards
stay there i will come around and get you
you're already sitting on a plank
responses: I don't want to go anywhere. There is water everywhere
I cannot move from this place. This place is still safer than the other areas
I dont want to go anywhere else
